            PROTECTED AREAS,TF028612-GET-PPA FOR PERU CONSERVATION UNITS

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Trust Fund for Protected
            Areas project has four major objectives: a) provide a long
            term and predictable source of funding for the protection of
            Peru's biodiversity through the establishment of a
            trust fund, the income of which would be used for financing
            the management of priority protected areas; b) improve the
            National Institute of Natural Resources (INRENA)'s
            capacity to protect and manage Peru's protected areas;
            c) provide the country with a reliable institutional
            mechanism to channel debt donations for sustainable
            development and conservation through bilateral and
            commercial debt-for nature swap agreements; and d) test the
            viability of trust funds as mechanisms for providing long
            term and sustainable funding for biodiversity conservation.
            The components of this project consist of: the endowment of
            the Trust Fund for the Conservation of Peru's Protected
            Areas (FONANPE); management of selected protected areas; and
            the project coordinating unit. The activities eligible for
            funding from the grant include: a) financing the recurrent
            costs of protected area management (staff salaries and
            operating expenses); b) drafting, revising and implementing
            management plans; c) establishing and managing buffer zones;
            d) training professionals in park and wildlife management;
            e) instituting environmental education and public awareness
            programs for communities associated with protected areas; f)
            institutional support for the strengthening of the field
            work of IRENA's Directorate General for National
            Protected Areas and Wildlife; g) administrative expenses of
            Pro Fondo Nacional para Areas Naturales Protegidas por el
            Estado (PROFNANPE) created as a not-for profit entity of
            public interest but under private law to administer the
            assets of FONANPE.
